name: owning
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
own
own verb
(HAVE LEGALLY)
B1 [ T not continuous ] to have something that legally belongs to you: We own our house. I've never owned a suit in my life.
More examplesFewer examplesThey own 20% of the company's stock.Who owns/holds the copyright on this article?She owns a popular tourist restaurant on the town's waterfront.The house is partly owned by her father.I get a real kick out of owning my own car.

own verb
(ADMIT)
[ I ] old-fashioned to admit: [ + (that) ] I own (that) I was not very happy with the group's decision.

own verb
(DEFEAT/DO WELL)
[ T ] mainly US informal to defeat someone completely or be much better than him or her; to perform extremely well: Last time we played them, we owned them! Beyoncé owned that stage tonight!

own verb
(ACCEPT)
[ T ] to accept and be responsible for something: It's your life - own it. I own who I was, and so I’m always open to admitting fault and talking through it.
